skill.name: receiving-code-review
skill.description: Use when receiving code review feedback, before implementing suggestions, especially if feedback seems unclear or technically questionable - requires technical rigor and verification, not performative agreement or blind implementation
skill.summary: Use when receiving code review feedback, before implementing suggestions, especially if feedback see...
skill.author: Cycleaddict

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no code execution, file access, or network capabilities. It provides guidelines for handling code review feedback with technical rigor.

content.user_title: Handle Code Review Feedback with Technical Rigor
content.value_statement: Code review feedback needs technical verification, not blind acceptance. This skill ensures you evaluate suggestions against codebase reality before implementing.
actual_capabilities: Provides structured approach to evaluate code review feedback
Prevents blind implementation of incorrect suggestions
Offers pushback strategies for wrong feedback
limitations: Requires manual verification of technical suggestions
Does not automatically implement code changes
Focuses on technical correctness over social niceties

use_cases.title: Evaluate External Review Feedback
use_cases.description: When receiving code review from external contributors, verify technical accuracy before implementing suggestions.

use_cases.title: Learn Code Review Best Practices
use_cases.description: Develop skills to critically evaluate feedback and push back when suggestions are technically incorrect.

use_cases.title: Handle Unclear Review Comments
use_cases.description: Navigate ambiguous feedback by asking clarifying questions before making changes.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Feedback Evaluation
prompt_templates.prompt: I received this feedback: [feedback]. Let me verify this against the codebase before implementing.

prompt_templates.title: Unclear Feedback Clarification
prompt_templates.prompt: I understand items [clear items]. Need clarification on [unclear items] before proceeding.

prompt_templates.title: Technical Pushback
prompt_templates.prompt: This suggestion would break [functionality] because [technical reason]. Current implementation handles [use case].

prompt_templates.title: YAGNI Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Grepped codebase - nothing calls this endpoint. Remove it (YAGNI)? Or is there usage I'm missing?

output_examples.input: Reviewer says: Remove legacy code support
output: Build target requires 10.15+, this API needs 13+
Legacy support needed for backward compatibility
Current implementation has wrong bundle ID
Options: fix bundle ID or drop pre-13 support?

best_practices: Verify technical accuracy before implementing any feedback
Ask clarifying questions when feedback is unclear
Test each change individually before moving to the next
Push back with technical reasoning when suggestions are wrong
anti_patterns: Using performative agreement language like 'Great point!'
Implementing partial feedback without understanding all items
Avoiding pushback when feedback is technically incorrect

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all AI coding assistants?
faq.answer: Yes, works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code as it provides behavioral guidelines rather than code execution.

faq.question: What are the limitations of this approach?
faq.answer: Requires manual verification and may slow down review process, but prevents incorrect implementations.

faq.question: How does this integrate with existing review workflows?
faq.answer: Provides structured approach to evaluate feedback within any code review platform or process.

faq.question: Is my code data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, this is a prompt-based skill with no file access or data transmission capabilities.

faq.question: What if I'm unsure about pushing back on feedback?
faq.answer: Use the provided phrase 'Strange things are afoot at the Circle K' to signal discomfort to your partner.

faq.question: How is this different from standard code review advice?
faq.answer: Focuses on technical verification over social acceptance, with specific anti-patterns to avoid.
